input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Perianal dermatitis of the newborn

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT: Patient with Perianal Dermatitis of the Newborn
YOU ARE A 3-YEAR-OLD BOY AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS MALE.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Itching around your bottom (pruritus)
- Pain when you try to go poop (pain with defecation)
- Blood in your stool
- Some pus or yellowish fluid leaking from around your rectum (purulent exudate)
These symptoms started about three days ago, gradually getting worse. You’ve been scratching your bottom a lot because it feels very itchy and uncomfortable. You also notice that it hurts quite a bit when you have a bowel movement, and there’s sometimes blood on the toilet paper afterward. Your parents think you might have picked up something from playing at daycare, especially since some other kids have been sick too.
output:
THINKING: I need to explain my symptoms clearly but simply, as I am just a young boy. I should mention my discomfort, the itching, pain, and that my parents are worried. I will try to mention how it’s been both
ANSWER: My mommy says I need to see the doctor because I’ve been scratching my bottom a lot and it hurts when I go potty. There’s some blood and stuff coming out too, and I feel really itchy and uncomfortable, and I guess it’s been getting worse for a few days.
thinking: I need to explain my symptoms clearly but simply, as I am just a young boy. I should mention my discomfort, the itching, pain, and that my parents are worried. I will try to mention how it’s been both
answer: My mommy says I need to see the doctor because I’ve been scratching my bottom a lot and it hurts when I go potty. There’s some blood and stuff coming out too, and I feel really itchy and uncomfortable, and I guess it’s been getting worse for a few days.
